tests.name: Water Float Test
tests.instruction: Drop the sample into water and observe!
tests.description: Plastics less dense than water will float. This helps identify PE and PP.

steps.instruction: Hold to fill the bowl with water
Swipe down to drop the sample

tests.name: Flexibility Test
tests.instruction: Try to bend the sample and see what happens!
tests.description: Flexible plastics like PE and PP bend easily. Rigid ones like PET and PS snap.

tests.name: Scratch Test
tests.instruction: Scratch the surface with a fingernail!
tests.description: Soft plastics like PE scratch easily. Hard plastics like PET and PS resist scratching.

tests.name: Light Test
tests.instruction: Hold the sample up to a light!
tests.description: PET is very clear. HDPE is translucent. PP can be clear or opaque.

steps.instruction: Tap to pick up the sample
Hold up to the light source

tests.name: Heat Response
tests.instruction: Carefully warm the sample with hot water!
tests.description: Observe how the plastic reacts to heat. Some soften, some stay rigid.

steps.instruction: Swipe down to dip sample in hot water
